basics.name: Frank McGeough
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Iâ€™ve worked extensively in various problem domains and helped develop high performance elegant solutions. I have an excellent background in software design in various languages but work primarily in Elixir with the Phoenix framework now. I'm focused on communicating well and providing valuable solutions for customers that work well, are extremely maintainable and scale and work seamlessly for back end staff.

work.name: PagerDuty, Inc
work.summary: Developed backend services in Elixir using the Phoenix framework
highlights: Wrote numerous blog posts to level-up developers in using Elixir
Designed and built a new system managing user creation and assignment to licensed products
Introduced team to Open Policy Agent as an approach to solving issues related to authorization

work.name: Weedmaps, Inc
work.summary: Developed backend services in Elixir using the Phoenix framework
highlights: Developed a permission system in Elixir using DynamoDB and Open Policy Agent

work.name: Vonage, Inc
work.summary: Worked in various roles as company moved from a startup to an acquisition by Vonage
highlights: Discovered the Elixir language and used it to build a number of tools that became the initial basis for the SRE team
Became the de-facto DBA and helped company with addressing performance issues
Joined small PBX startup Vocalocity in Atlanta

awards.title: Patent: Database synchronization and organization system and method
awards.summary: A 'data centric' approach to updating databases on computer systems of an intermittently connected database system providing greater scalability then traditional replication systems.
